#include<iostream>
using namespace std;

int main()
{
    int t;
    cin>>t;

    while(t--)
    {
        long long int n;
        cin>>n;

        //When n is odd; The middle element comes out to be 4.5; Not possible.
        if(n%2!=0)
            cout<<"0"<<endl;
        else
           {
                n=(n/2) - 1;
                cout<<"9";
                //Equation has 10 solutions. Namely,$(0,9)$, $(1,8)$, $(2,7)$, $(3,6)$, $(4,5)$, $(5,4)$, $(6,3)$, $(7,2)$, $(8,1)$, $(9,0) $
                //But according to the question $d1$ cannot be zero. Therfore there are $9$ solutions in total
                while(n--)
                cout<<"0";

                cout<<endl;
            }

    }
}
